channel.title: eda on Johanie Fournier
channel.description: Recent content in eda on Johanie Fournier

item.title: 30 Years of Precipitation for Centre-du-Qu√©bec: Trends, Patterns & Anomalies
item.description: Understanding long-term precipitation patterns is crucial for climate research, agriculture, and water resource management. In this post, we analyze 30 years of high-resolution precipitation data from the AgERA5 dataset, focusing on a single administrative region in Quebec. Using exploratory data analysis (EDA) techniques, we uncover trends, seasonal variations, and anomalies to gain deeper insights into precipitation dynamics

item.title: St. Lawrence Lowlands Precipitation Data: 30-Year Trends & Anomalies
item.description: Understanding long-term precipitation patterns is essential for climate research, agriculture, and water resource management. In this post, we analyze 30 years of precipitation data from the AgERA5 dataset for St. Lawrence Lowlands, using exploratory data analysis (EDA) techniques to uncover trends, seasonal variations, and anomalies.

item.title: TyT2024W21 - EDA:Carbon Majors Emissions Data
item.description: This week we are exploring historical emissions data from Carbon Majors. They have complied a database of emissions data going back to 1854. In this first part, I start with some exploratory data analysis.

item.title: This is the begining of a cheat sheet!
item.description: I will list here all the little snipset of code that I look up all the time.
